newsitem.title: USA: US TV industry group to unveil ratings Thursday.
newsitem.headline: US TV industry group to unveil ratings Thursday.

text.p: A television industry group said Tuesday it will formally unveil its system for rating programs on Thursday.

The group of broadcast, cable-TV and Hollywood executives is expected to sign off on the plan Wednesday to create a motion-picture style system that will rate shows based on their suitability for children of different ages, especially those under age 14.

Despite loud criticism from lawmakers, parents' groups, consumers advocates, educators and others, the executives have decided against a content-based system that would spell out the level of sex, violence and strong language.
The ratings are expected to include six broad categories.
Four are expected to be: TV-G for shows suitable for all ages; TV-PG for parental guidance suggested; TV-14 for kids aged 14 and older; and TV-M for mature audiences.
The other two will cover children's programs, including those suitable for all kids and those suitable for children older than seven.
